ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gíŋ ńgɔɔn nò né Yenésè na lekwò mbɔ́ɔntè yépʉ́a ngie:
en: The word of the Lord came to Jonah a second time:

ngiemboon: «Lu ssé, ńgʉa tsɛ̀ɛ máa tÿǒsoŋo Ninive, ésáʼ nkʉ̀ gẅie n ka cʉ́me mbwó gù.»
en: “Get up! Go to the great city of Nineveh   and preach  # 3:2 Jr 1:17; Ezk 2:7 the message that I tell you.”

ngiemboon: Yenésè júʼ ncwò Cʉ̀apʉ̀a na sɔɔn lekwò ŋwɛ́, ńcʉ́me mánzsè ńgʉa né tÿǒsoŋo Ninive páʼ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a tsẅǐ né yé. Atÿǒsoŋo Ninive ŋwɛ́ á laa mvfò Ssé éshÿéenshÿéen fáŋ tà lekelé tà ḿbume, á gwɔ́ légiŋ giŋ lyɛ̌ʼ sétá.
en: Jonah got up and went to Nineveh according to the Lord’s command.

ngiemboon: Yenésè kúu tÿǒsoŋ ńdɔgɔ ndùŋmvfò lyɛʼɛ́ láʼ, ńgiŋe ésáʼa mbwó láʼ ńgɔɔn ngie: «É ge gwaa gwɔ́ melyɛʼɛ́ láʼ móm lekùɔ, mé pyága tÿǒsoŋ Ninive.»
en: Jonah set out on the first day of his walk in the city and proclaimed,   “In forty days Nineveh will be demolished! ”

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a Ninive gwóon ńjúʼu yɔɔn shwóŋè Ssé, ńzáb ntʉ́m wɔ́b mǒ. Ésele ńzáb ngie: Pɔ́ ge kwoŋ kwoŋ ńnéŋe nzyè, á nyìŋ té vʉʼʉ tsɔ̌, léfó na ngàŋa mmó, ńgʉa ńkúu na mbóŋ, pɔ́ ge pú kaa mepɔ̀ɔn éshu, é lɔg lúŋ.
en: Then the people of Nineveh believed God. They proclaimed a fast   and dressed in sackcloth #— #from the greatest of them to the least.

ngiemboon: Afùɔ la gwɔ́ tà ńjúʼu mmó gie á ne ńcʉa, éfó na lʉŋe lefùɔ yé ésẅɛ́ʼ, éfó mbùm ye, ésẅɛ nzsǒ lefùɔ, ńkaa pɔ̀ɔn éshu, ńtém ntsẅɛ̀ʼ ye na pfó, ńdɔg ńdúŋ.
en: When word reached the king of Nineveh, he got up from his throne, took off his royal robe, covered himself with sackcloth,   and sat in ashes.

ngiemboon: Ḿbɔ́ɔnte ńtsẅi mé gʉa tsɛ̀ɛ tÿǒsoŋ, ésáʼ ńgɔɔn ngie: «Afùɔ pâ mekěm pé tsẅǐ ngie mé lʉʼʉ mbwó pʉ̀a pie é tsẅé tÿǒsoŋ, lépfɛ́ɛ mmó kà lénúu mmó wɔ́ɔ, tà mbɔɔ ntse, ńnye menɔ̀ɔn te jÿɔ́g: é mefòŋ, é menjʉ̀njÿò mbɔɔ mvfó.
en: Then he issued a decree   in Nineveh:

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a mesoŋ tà mbɔɔ menɔ̀ɔn gẅiin lékaa mepɔ̀ɔn éshu, ńdɔg ńdúŋ. Á poŋ ngie wɛ̌ nyìŋ wɔ́ɔ sẅíŋte Ssé né ngwòŋ ntʉ́m wé ntsèm, wɛ̌ nyìŋ wɔ́ɔ gwáʼ pamánzsè tepòŋ pie à giŋe mǒ, lâ menò tág mie à ne ńgÿo.
en: Furthermore, both people and animals must be covered with sackcloth, and everyone must call out earnestly to God.   Each must turn from his evil ways  # 3:8 Is 1:16–19; 55:6–7; Jr 18:11 and from his wrongdoing.  # 3:8 Or injustice, or violence

ngiemboon: Mé ée ntěen ńzsé wɔ́. Ngwɔ́ Ssé kúbe mmó gie à kaʼá légÿo na pege, ngwɔ́ à gwáʼa máa gyáŋalóŋ gie à lɔg ńgwɔ́ nzèm pege, tà á le gíŋ ńgÿo pege kwéte wɔ́.»
en: Who knows?   God may turn and relent; he may turn from his burning anger so that we will not perish.  # 3:9 Jr 18:7–8

ngiemboon: E Ssé gyá ntí gie pʉ̀a Ninive lɔ̌g ńgÿo púʼu. Páʼ pɔ́ gwáʼ megiŋé tepòŋ mɔ́b. Ńdeen ńké ńnyé ngɔ́ʼ gie à ka kwaŋa lézába twó pɔ́b, à te gíŋ ńgÿo tsɔ́ mmó na pɔ́b wɔ́.
en: God saw their actions #— #that they had turned from their evil ways    #— #so God relented from the disaster  # 3:10 Ex 32:14; Am 7:3,6 he had threatened them with. And he did not do it.
